dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous vista, green and lush. Beneath the canopy of branches, a small brook babbles ove moss covered rocks. A bullfrog CROAKS loudly from its perch atop what looks like... a human leg? Sure enough, it’s attached to A BODY semi-submerged in th water -- unrecognizable in the rapidly darkening light.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN CREDITS
dialogues.text: TIME ELLIPSE: Dusk gives way to night. The moon casts a blue hue over the woods. The sun rises, illuminating the body for the first time. It’s PAUL. His clothing is largely torn away, revealing purple flesh swollen with open sores. There is the dull h of swarming flies. A shaft of sun carves its way through the thick nest of branches and creeps across the glistening water. It trave Paul’s torso, up to his neck. As the light hits his face, his eyelids unexpectedly BURST OPEN and Paul tries to scr but only rasping air escapes his lips. As he struggles to his feet - blood, puss, even small chu of skin splash into the water. We follow the swirling GORE as it’s carried off downstrea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK, widening our view of the forest and following route of the strean. We RACE its course, across a meadow until we reach:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a sign reading: “Down Home Spring Water” The stream dead enda into a man made pond, from which protrude several enormous steel pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow the pipes into the Plant, and then the route of water through the production line. The water gets pumped into holding tanks, then into the individual bottles. The company slogan appears on each and every plastic containe “Down Home Purity - From Us to You...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul looks around dizzily for orientation. Dense forest o three sides. Beside him, a steep embankment and at its crest, he sees something. A passing CAR? A road? He takes a few steps, clearly intent to make the climb, t notices something on his bare chest. A leech. He plucks i away. And sees another. And another. He’s covered in them He panics, tearing them off his flesh with wild-eyed disg each bloated leech leaving behind an oozing wound.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. EMBANKMENT, MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Paul crawls his way up the steep incline. The progress is taxing. CRACK! His ankle buckles, twisting at a sharp ang and shooting a thick stream of blood. Paul’s watering eyes squeeze closed, but he does not stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul reaches the summit, his heart pounding in his head. world is spinning as he limps, delirious, into the road.. WHAP! A school bus smashes through Paul, instantly liquefying him and exploding his contents over the front grill. His remains are shotput twenty yards, then cartwhe down the embankment and SPLASH land back into the stream. The bus wheels screech as the vehicle skids to a stop. Th road fills with the sound of SCREAMING CHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The school bus and its hysterical occupants are surrounde lit flares. The unconscious BUS DRIVER is loaded into a waiting ambulance. The only other officials on the scene - two FOREST RANGER one male, one female - are pulling barricades across the road. She’s young and frumpy. The Male Ranger [20s, buzzcut] is clearly quite high on his responsibilities. A SHERIFF’S CRUISER arrives, lights flashing. The door op and WINSTON’S booted leg glides to the pavement. He approaches the bus, full swagger in his step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s mayhem. Kids are Screaming, crying, some have alread been sick and others are on the verge. REVEAL Winston, impatiently competing for their attention

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Kids, I’m Deputy Winston. (no response) All right now. If we can all just settle down. Settle. Everything is under control. (still nothing) All right! I’m going to need you to shut up! Just shut the hel. up! The wailing intensifies. Winston tugs his hair in frustration... then pulls his GUN. This seems to work: A HUSH falls over the bus. The kids stare, saucer-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Good. Thank you. Now look, the bus seems to have hit a moose or something. We’re gonna get you off to school very soon okay? A LITTLE BOY raises his hand. Winston lets the boy wait a moment before calling on him.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Can I go to the baf-room? A chorus of high-pitched voices erupt. Everyone has to go the goddamn bathroom. Winston’s world threatens to plunge back into chaos, so he holds up his gun: a reminder. The HUSH descends. Winston indicates to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: What number? The boy slowly raises two fingers.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: No. No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston is done. Investigation over. In the background, t Male Ranger is dutifully inspecting the bus. Winston and Female Ranger light cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how’s it going? (awkwardly flirtatious) I got a forty in my cruiser... The Male Ranger peels a strip of bloody cloth out of the buses grill. It’s part of a pants leg.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Found something! Don’t think deer wear American Eagle.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: It was a deer. Let’s get these kids to school. Or home. Wherever the fuck they go. The Male Ranger has now followed the splatter to the edge the embankment. He looks down and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: There’s a trail of blood - seems to go down this hill!

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Okay then - let’s wrap things up. The Male Ranger approaches, gets right in Winston’s face.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Look, something died here and I take that real serious. You need to go somewhere, that’s fine by me. T‘ll put it in my report. I know over-promoted incompetence when I see it, “Deputy.”

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Maybe we should check into this a little further. Winton sighs deeply, worn down.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Fine! Fine. We’ll poke around a bit. Jesus. The rumble of an approaching large vehicle -- it’s a Down Home Water Bottle delivery truck. Winston waves it past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER eyes the disaster with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking gross. cur TO:

dialogues.text: The Water Bottle delivery truck proceeds on it’s journey. to see a sign which reads: “Leaving Bunyon County”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck drives past a SPORTS STADIUM... But we don’t stop. Later: WE DRIVE PAST...CITY HALL... But we don’t slow down. WE DRIVE PAST...AN OLD FOLKS HOME... We make turns onto a suburban RESIDENTIAL STREET. We driv Past UPSCALE HOUSES and up to a LARGE HIGH SCHOOL. The truck passes the entrance. The high school is spared? No. The truck STOPS SUDDENLY. The white reverse lights illuminate. The truck backs up, stops, and then TURNS INT THE HIGH SCHOOL DRIVEWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck pulls up to the curb. It comes to rest by the school entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER is wheeling the hand-truck down the hallway. W pass all kinds of regular high school activity: kids talk at lockers, kids walking around, kids making out. Some attach balloons along the walls of the hallway. We pass through a set of doors into...

dialogues.text: Yeah just drop that anywhere. A SKINNY GIRL moving through the Line reaches for one of driver’s new bottles. As her hand touches it, she hesitat and then... decides on a SODA. A FAT GIRL moving through the line reaches for one of the bottles. She hesitates. Instead, she grabs two large CHOCOLATE MILKS. ZACH, our hero, pulls a water right from the case. He’s a small guy, with obvious potential and kind features. Waiting for the Lunch Lady’s attention, he opens the bott and is JUST ABOUT TO SIP when A HAND SMACKS it away from lips. We see Jack and Bob pulling their STOLEN WATER BOTTLES ou from beneath their jackets.

And in exchange, you’re bringing me, my date, and her - (pointing at Brooke) ~ to Chris’s party. End of discussion. Before anyone can get a word in edgewise, Shams is moving across the diner. JZach’s heart rockets into his throat. ZACH’S POV: Shams approaches Brooke. Introduces himself. Chats. He CAN’T HEAR what they’re saying. Shams takes a seat. They keep talking. Brooke starts LAUGHING. scotr Holy shit. I think it’s working! Suddenly Brooke stands and approaches the table. still smiling, she looks straight at Zach.

Et ooooococe!!! Zach shoots Shama a look; “what the hell?!” Sham’s shrugs back; “Sorry dude.” EXT. “HAMBURGER HUT” - CONTINUOUS Zach chases her out. He gets a hand on her shoulder, turn her around.

Now that I have your attention I’d like to pay, I think you’re very intriguing, not to mention quite beautiful. I’ve secured an invitation to Chris’s party, which at the very least promises to be very memorable. Of course, tonight is also prom and due to the previously discussed “lack of balls” condition from which I suffer, I have no date. If you also are without a date, I’d be sublimely excited and deeply honored to take you. She stares at him ~- then smiles, flattered and charmed.

dialogues.text: I ain’t got no water man, all I got is a Forty. But if you want some water I'll find some for you, okay? You just sit tight buddy, 1I’11 take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lies in the stream. END FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: The Male Ranger prods the body with a stick. It SQUIRTS liquid, missing him by inches.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that. The Ranger backs off, startled.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: You know what did this?

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: A disease, I think. Eats your flesh right off.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Nasty! The Male Ranger looks from the body to the blood carried in the water. Eyes widen as he puts two and two together.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Oh God. Where do you suppose the water goes?

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Why?  20.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: What if it feeds a well? Ora reservoir?

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Oh fuck...

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Exactly. (re: the stream) We need to see where this goes.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RANGER
dialogues.text: (reassuringly, to Winston) I’1l keep looking for that deer.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Contact Fish and Game for extraction. They can get tissue samples tested. (to Winston) Let’s get a move on. Winston hangs his head. This is not good. INT. FOREMAN’S OFFICE, BOTTLING PLANT - AFTERNOON The disgruntled FOREMAN faces Winston and the two Rangers dabs his sweating brow with a dirty handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Just a little flu. Been going around and kinda snuck up on me. I appreciate your concern, but everything is fine.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: Do you do any regular tests on the water itself?

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Water is pure. I drink it all the time! Everyone here does. Winston and the Ranger follow his gaze to the factory flo below. Everything is not fine. WORKERS are universally suffering from symptoms; coughing, dizziness, fevers. PAN BACK just as the Foreman grabs a bottle off his desk.

dialogues.speaker: FOREMAN
dialogues.text: Gotta stay hydrated. It’s the best thing. As the Foreman tilts back his head to drink, they SPOT a purplish sore on the underside of his chin.  21. Winston takes a slow step back from the man.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (to Foreman) Will you excuse us a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston and the Ranger talk urgently just outside the off The Ranger is chomping at the bit to escalate things.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: We gotta call the Feds. The FBI--

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Hold on a sec. We close this place, we should have this more or less contained. QUICK FLASHBACK: They both recall the image of Winston wa the water delivery truck past the accident scene. WINSTON (CONT’D) shit.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: (enthuslastic) I’m making the call! The Ranger rushes off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) No one probably drank any...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack pulls his Camaro up to the curb. He leans to the backseat and grabs his Letterman’s Jacket. We see the FINISHED WATER BOTTLE LAYING BESIDE IT. He walks to the back of the car and opens the trunk. Insi we see flowers, an envelope with Natasha’s name on it, an banner. The banner reads: “I LOVE YOU NATASHA”. Jack squeezes these items into his backpack. He’s pumped. EXT. NATASHA’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS A gorgeous two-story home. Jack sneaks up to a window. Inside, Natasha is trying on a prom dress with her mother They’re chatting and having a good time. Jack smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She‘s gonna love this.  22. Jack walks around to the backyard, looks up and FINDS a bedroom window with pink curtains. He smiles again. Seen from behind, REVEAL that the back of Jack’s neck is covered in a dripping sore. He quickly inspects the ivy-covered trellis and begins to climb. He makes quick progress, though the rough ivy keep getting in the way. WOOOSH! A couple of branches beneath his right foot SNAP, and he falle about a foot. CRUNCH! Sharp pieces of wood nick his palm.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Damn! Jack keeps moving, wincing as his hands make each grab. BLOOD trickles down his fingers. He takes another grab, and his face scrunches in pain. Th sore has spread to his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What the..? The fingers on his left hand slowly open revealing some p The hand loses it’s strength. RIIIIPPP!!!:! HIS HAND SLID BOWN THE IVY, TWIGS TEAR HIS PALMS APART. He anchors his feet. Tears fill his eyes as he looks down It’s almost 20 feet to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You can make it. He closes his eyes, and takes a few more grabs... each ti losing more skin. The eave is just a couple of feet further. He stares at t bedroom. It’s not too far away. Jack reaches the lip of the eave. He rests for a moment. SQUAP! A knuckle pops. Blood spurts on his tux. He locks down again. The ground appears to be swaying. Hi breath comes in huge rasps.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (very faint) Help...! Help me...! No one‘s gonna hear. He’s on his own.  23. In one motion, he SWINGS himself up, landing on the roof! is on his stomach, spread-eagle on the black asphalt shingles. He lays his cheek on the stubbly surface. Then... his body begins to slide.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: No. No. He lands on the SHARP EDGE of the rain gutter. KINK! THE EDGE CUTS HIS HANDS AND FOREARMS. Blood floats along white rim. He looks up at the bedroom. Natasha is inside, changing. Despite the pain, Jack is momentarily distracte She’s a hottie.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Damn. The sound of BENDING METAL. THE GUTTER GIVES. Jack FALLS. SNAP! His body folds as he crunches off the patio table a rolls into a deep thatch of bushes. His face hits the fir tundra. His backpack bounces onto the lawn. Jack lays in the bushes, trying to speak. He only gurgles a mouthful of blood before passing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shams is in a suit, rather than a tux. It looks good, tho doesn’t fit quite right. Shams’ house in general is cut f a lesser cloth. Shams turns to split, and runs smack into his father, SARGEANT FRANK [50s, mean.]

dialogues.speaker: SARGEANT FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m not bailing your loser ass out of jail. Whatever this night has in store, just bear that in mind.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Okay. Right back at you. EXT. ZACH’S HOUSE - EVENING Zach runs up the steps of his house. A tuxedo bag is drap over his shoulder. He has a spring in his step. He flies through the front door.  24. INT. ZACH’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Zach bounds into the hall, and then up the stairs - takin them 3 at a time. Zach enters his bedroom, puts the tux on his bed, and tur on the stereo. Zach goes to the closet and pulls out everything he needs.

dialogues.speaker: BEGINS. UPBEAT MUSIC OVER
dialogues.text: INT. BROOKE’S HOUSE - EVENING Brooke sits at the dinner table with her PARENTS and LITT SISTER. She has her hair setting with curlers and pins. S clearly isn’t the type for make-up and fancy dress, and manages to looks both excited and miserable at the same t BROOKE’S SISTER I thought you said - boys, dances, all that - was bull... BROOKE’S MOM Language!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Don’t you have dolls to play with? BROOKE’S SISTER Who’d have thought. My sister in pink. The two share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delivery trucks roll in to the Banquet Hall parking lot. sign outside reads: WELCOME CLASS OF 2006.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big piles of chairs and large tables are being moved into large ballroom by professionals. Student Band members set up their instruments. cur TO:  25. INT. KATIE’S HOUSE - EVENING Katie is on the phone in her bedroom. She stands in front a full length mirror wearing her prom dress.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I know that I should be there, but it’s Chris’s party - and this might be my last chance. (for emphasis) Chris's party. Katie sees a SIX INCH SORE on her left shoulder. She chec up close. It’s blistering, black and green.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oh my God! (back to the call) Not The balloons are in clusters of five, the streamers get braided. We talked about this! She goes to her closet and pulls out A BUNCH OF DRESSES. drapes them across herself while looking in the mirror. One has a high back that will COVER THE SORE.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Because Shams invited me. Shams. My date. (impatiently) The guy in Geometry that never shuts up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Tyler, both in tuxes, struggle with an enormous steel tank; rolling it on edge towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Move it, fuck-nut. Jesus - you’re such a little bitch...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Dougie? Doug and Tyler instinctively drop the heavy cylinder with resounding CLANG. It’s DR. VIOLA, kind-faced and an even kinder heart, but definitely soft in the head...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Dad?  26.

dialogues.speaker: DR. VIOLA
dialogues.text: Don’t you boys look handsome. Is that little Tyler? {noticing the tank) What are you doing with my Nitrous?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Nitrous? Serious? Ohmygod, I thought it was Helium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Helium balloons being inflated. Kids are raising a large sign across the wall. It reads: TIME OF OUR LIVES. Mr. Sheppard and the lunch-lady are on the dance floor. T share a modest tango while people work around them. INT. SCOTT’S BASEMENT - EVENING Scott ushers Eric into the techno-geek paradise that is h father’s basement. 42 inch Plasma widescreen. Tower speakers. Massive amplifier. And resting on it’s own glorious pedestal... the X-Box. Scott presses the power button ominously. scorr May the mayhem begin. The boys’ faces are bathed in light as the “HALO 2” openi graphics fill the screen, and bass rattles the earth.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: (deeply humbled) Awesome. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUCK DRIVER sits at the counter of a small greasy sp diner. He has a bottle of water in his right hand. He finishes chewing his dinner. HE LOOKS SICK. He coughs out his mouthful of food. BLOOD sprays all over the counter. He coughs again. Another. Another. A bigger one. Another. A waitress ducks out of the way. Customers scramble to avoid the flying blood.  27.

dialogues.speaker: DINER CUSTOMER 1
dialogues.text: Call an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: DINER CUSTOMER 2
dialogues.text: What was he eating? cuUT TOs INT. ZACH’S HOUSE - EVENING Zach runs down his hallway stairs. He is dressed in his tuxedo. He carries the corsage. His PARENTS stand by the open door. They, like Zach, are small and full of warmth. ZACH’S DAD I’m so proud of you. ZACH’S MOM Look at my little man. ZACH’S DAD If you need anything, don’t hesitate to call, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’s Prom. I think I’1l be okay. ZACH’S MOM Did you remember your inhaler? Zach loves them, but enough with the neurotic babying already. He kisses them and walks out. curt TO: EXT. BROOKE’S HOUSE - EVENING zach escorts Brooke towards the limo, while her MOM and D snap photos like rabid paparazzi. She looks gorgeous. Zach opens the limo door for her. He’s about to... but chickens out of a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke ride in the limo, drinking champagne, and sharing awkward glances. REVEAL Shams and Katie are also along. He’s aggressively trying to get his lips on her. She’s having none of it. Shams PUTS HIS HEAD OUT THROUGH THE ROOF WINDOW. He pumps both arms in the air.  28.

dialogues.speaker: THIS IS FREAKIN
dialogues.text: The limo stops at a red light as he’s yelling. An Asian g waiting at the light in a convertible, looks back.

dialogues.speaker: ASIAN DRIVER
dialogues.text: Take it easy, kid. It’s just prom. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE The limo pulls up to the house. There are several other limos, and a number of cars. The house is HUGE. It sIvTs ATOP A HILL on a large piece of land, by itself. The enti backside is SURROUNDED BY TREES. Zach, Brooke, Sham, and Katie finish their champagne as t ease up the driveway. MUSIC FADES. END OF MONTAGE. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - EVENING There’s a swimming pool, hot tub, wooden cabana and table with food. Streamers, Torches and Multi-Colored Patio Lig create the mood. Chris is mixing drinks. Music BLARES from backyard speakers. The party is awingin Sasha walks past with a tray of JELLO SHOTS in her hand. A JOINT is being passed around. It arrives at Bob.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and Jack - we’re taking a year off for some serious training. Then it's off to the NFL. {off the blank stares) Pro-wrestling is the back-up plan. He passes to Moose.

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think about the future. You know, college. And... wait. I forgot what I was gonna say. Moose takes a second, bigger hit, and passes it to Weber.

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: College is a scam to maintain the middle-class. And the future is fucked man, totally fucked,  29. Weber takes a hit. He offers the joint to Val. She does a weak inhale and pantomimes an exhale.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look at the colors. I am so wasted. Weber rolls his eyes. He walks off, and passes the joint ASHLEY [token slut.] She takes a huge hit, and hands it t JIMMY, a true pothead. Ashley joins Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (to Weber, re: Val) ) Who the hell did you come with?

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: Not with her. (on second thought) What do you care, skank? She flips him off and they part ways. BACK to Jimmy. He inhales, savors thoughtfully, and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Man, who rolled this joint? It’s amateur hour. He lubricates it with his mouth then takes another deep h He walks to a GROUP standing a few feet away, tapas a guy the shoulder. He turns around. It’s.. » ZACH, with Shams, Katie, and Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: ‘Urammim. «s+ He looks to Brooke for confirmation. Zach is out of his element, he’d be game but... she shakes her head. ZACH (CONT’D) No thanks. Maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: None for me. The prom committee would kill me, can you imagine? (eager) Have you seen Chris?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: No. Wait, actually yes. (thinks, very high) Who's “Chris?”

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: I’l1l take that, thanks. Shame takes a puff, smiles, and then looks to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Does anybody want a hit? Heads turn. Lots of hands go up. A small group begins to FORM AROUND THE JOINT, including:

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Where the hell is Natasha?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (anxiously) And where the hell is Jack? EXT. NATASHA’S HOUSE - EVENING Natasha pouts in a bench on her front porch, miserable. H dress is rumpled. Her FATHER sits quietly beside her.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe that football obsessed retard stood me up. NATASHA’S DAD I’m so sorry, sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: Thanks, pop. It’s just... it’s Prom, you know? PROM. She starts to CRY, wipes a finger beneath her nose. NATASHA’S DAD I never liked him. The dad holds her tight. Suddenly a SCREAM. Alarmed, they RUSH towards the source - into the backyard Natasha’s MOM is frozen in SHOCK, staring into the bushes The family TERRIER is licking blood from JACK’S UPTURNED PALMS! Jack’s body is horrifically contorted. NATASHA’S DAD NO, Baxter! The dog YELPS. Natasha shields her face and turns away. Jack MOVES. They all JUMP. He weakly mouths “HELP.” NATASHA’S DAD Dee, get an ambulance! Natasha’s mom runs inside. Natasha’s dad notices the tux, sees the fallen backpack and gifts. He smiles Badly.  31. NATASHA’S DAD Help’s on the way.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. BOTTLING PLANT
dialogues.text: The building has been swarmed by Feds. A dozen Black sUvs and white vans are parked outside. Inside, INFECTED WORKERS have been herded into the breakr They pound against the locked doors. Intermittent SCREAMS and MOANS pierce the walls. It’s haunting. Officers part to make way for AGENT RIDGE [tall, intimidating, a man of very, very few words.] He approach the MALE RANGER.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: (towards the breakroom) They’re all gonna die?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: cDc is en route.

dialogues.speaker: MALE RANGER
dialogues.text: The CDC -- it won’t be... like that guy in the stream? Agent Ridge ignores him, turning his attention to Winston whom he sizes up with a single up-down glance. He doesn’t like what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Deputy Winston, Bunyon County. Sidelong glances and WHISPERS ripple through the room.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: Bunyon County? (intrigued) An infected patient disappeared from your hospital? In the woods, folks burned in an open bonfire? We‘ve just started looking into it, but what a shitstorm. Winston can only stare back at him. His mouth opens to protest, then closes, A Junior Agent rushes in:

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AGENT 1
dialogues.text: Ridge! We picked up a report from Mt. Vernon, 30 miles East. The water truck was located at a diner. The driver was DOA.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AGENT 2
dialogues.text: And an ambulance just picked up a kid, same town, different area. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNIOR AGENT 2 (cont'd) They’re reporting infection - “unknown pathogen.”

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: (to Junior Agents) You know what to do. (to Winston) Let’s roll, “Deputy.” INT. CHRIS‘ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - EVENING Chris carries bottles of wine across his elegant living r Bob, with a beer cup in his hand and his tuxedo shirt tot unbuttoned, is looking at a fine African statue. He touch it, fondling the wood.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You break it, you buy it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (defensive) I’m not doing anything. (as if this explains) Ashley is totally ticked at me. T think it’s gonna be World War III.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Prom wouldn’t be prom without at least one. Bob shrugs. Who cares. Chris sets the wine at the bar and surveys the digs. Joints are going around. Everybody has cup. The music is up. The party is a tremendous success. Zach and Brooke are sharing a deck chair, Zach is slowly coming out of his shell. A tray of jello shots passes and they each snag one.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You just eat it?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: (mouth full of Jello) Yeah! Zach does the same. BEAT. The moment is pregnant with a potential kiss. Brooke, shyly leans a bit closer... just Moose and CINDY, his (enormous) date, JUMP INTO THE POOL, ruining the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: Fuck all ya’1llt!! cCannonballtt!! The resulting tidal wave drenches the patio. Revelers GRO  33. One splash falls on some shoes, we rise up to see Katie's back. Her sore is now visible around the base of her neck Nobody hae noticed, including Shams, talking to (at) her.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: So, long story long, I was accepted to all three schools, but Columbia has the best program. After living in this shitpit so long, I really think I’m more of a city guy... (sees she’s not listening) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I feel weird. I think I’m... (with realization) Drunk?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: (un-smooth) Oh - You want to... maybe we can find an empty room inside? Disgusted, Katie grabs ANOTHER glass of champagne and sta abruptly. She covers her mouth to stifle a rasping COUGH.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I’ll be right back. Poor Shams is abandoned. Katie smiles as she passes peopl mingling in her stupor.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hi guys. Anybody seen Chris? She keeps walking. We check out the whole party from her wobbly point of view. she looks over at Weber.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Sugarpants! Wait, you’re not Chris. We begin to see conversations as Katie does, in an audibl blurred SLOW MOTION.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY IN SLOW-MO
dialogues.text: If you see Bob, hide me-- Katie teeters, the people around her lose focus. Her feet gives way. She grabs Bob on her way down and hangs on.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Whoa! Careful there.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I fell. Bob helps her get her footing. He sees the sore on her ne  34.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Katie, what’s that?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: What’s what? Bob points. She tries to glance over her own shoulder to her neck - which of course is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It sort of hurts. (touching it) Ouch. What is it? She’s attracting attention. Then... CRUNCH! Katie loses her balance. The STILETTO HEEL on her right foot SNAPS in half. Her ankle twists and she FALLS. Her ELBOW hits the ground first. IT CRUSHES INTO THE CEME CRAAACKKKKKK!!! It opens on impact and the bones snap Lik celery, blood flying in the air. Feet jump to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Holy crap!

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (incredibly repulsed) What the hell, Katie! Katie tries to get up. She desperately scans for help, an finally SPOTS CHRIS. Her dress has ripped. The sore on he back is EXPOSED. EVERYBODY BACKS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Chris! Please, help me.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Katie. Don’t move.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Come here. Katie keeps moving, LOOKING FOR SOMEONE TO GRAB HOLD OF. Katie gets up, she hears CLICKING from her legs. COUGH! Blood flies - it cannons towards Bob. He’s able to dodge out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Take it easy! Stop moving! Zach and Brook arrive. As does Shams. Katie's staggering around like a zombie and getting uncomfortably close. The is bedlam as people scurry away from her.  35.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It hurts... Help.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: I’ll call 911! Val backs into a corner and starts talking into her phone Chris retreats INTO THE HOUSE. He’s followed by others.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Chris! Where are you going? Katie moves towards Jimmy. He too scurries inside. Zach and Brooke hold on to each other.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with her? Moose and Cindy RACE TO THE HOUSE. Then Shams and Ashley. Bob... Weber... they’re all abandoning her.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Wait! She‘s still coughing... just missing their backs. Jimmy begins to SHUT THE SLIDING DOORS. Zach and Brooke r through. Katie is almost to the door...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: DON’T LEAVE ME--- Jimmy SLAMS it SHUT, right in her face. Katie BANGS on th glass. People inside CANNOT BELIEVE WHAT THEY ARE SEEING. Katie’s arm is hanging off the bone. Blood is all over he She looks pleadingly at Chris. He’s scared.

dialogues.speaker: CBRIS
dialogues.text: Back Away, Katie! You're getting shit everywhere!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Don’t look at me like that Chris! Katie scans the patio. Some kids are on the far side of t pool, frozen. The rest are inside. She’s all alone.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: {to Katie) An ambulance is coming, Katie!

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: You hear that? Help is on the way-- Katie erupts into a tantrum.  36. KATIE (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (tormented, quietly) This isn’t right. Katie stamps her foot as she pleads, HARD. STAMP. STAMP. the next one, KABOOM! Her knee explodes, spraying bits of blood and pulp all over the glass door. Katie SCREAMS, hopping on her remaining leg. Brooke holds her hand over her mouth, choking back vomit. Some girls c

dialogues.speaker: I NEED A TOWEL
dialogues.text: Katie topples and her body starts to roll. She moans as s heads towards the pool. SPLASH! Katie hits the water. Everyone stares, frozen, as she sinks to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Somebody help her! No one moves. Zach slides back the door and steps outside

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Be careful. Zach grabs the POOL STRAINER from its hook. Curious, Chri silently emerges. In clusters, everyone trails behind — t herd following its leader. Zach dips the pole into the water, angling it towards Katie.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Don’t you touch her, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Not a fucking chance.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: She's still alive...

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Grab it if you can, Katie! I/11 pull you out...! The spectators jostle closer for a better view. Katie wiggles, looks up at Zach, then HER EYES CLOSE. There is silence. Katie’s blood fills the once blue water,

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: (defensive, panicked) We couldn’t do anything. We didn’t know what to do.  37.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: We’re all witnesses. A CHIME. Wendy, the girl from the locker room, has finall arrived with FOUR FRIENDS, each holding bottles of liquor

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Hey y'all: Party, Party! (beat) What’s everybody staring at! Wendy’s friends stop, shocked by the gruesome scene: Bloo the house, Blood on the cement, Dead girl in the pool. We marches on, oblivious... then SLIPS in a puddle of Katie Her arms cartwheel for balance. SPLOOSH. She lands in the pool and surfaces immediately with one of KATIE’S ARMS — splashing frantically. She’s hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: What the fuck! What the FUCK! Without a word, her four friends spin on their heels and leave. CHIMES on the gate tinkle behind them.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXI. SUV, CONVOY
dialogues.text: The CONVOY of Federal SUVS speeds through the night. Winston rides with Ridge, and is sandwiched between two AGENTS built like linebackers. He looks like a child.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: You know, you can let me off anywhere. Agent Ridge grins silently. WINSTON (CONT’D) Near a Burger King would be good, but I’m open. (off continued silence) What do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: You’re a link to the source of the epidemic. I may have... questions.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Questions? You never even talk. And I’m not a link to anything. I got no idea what you’re-- Agent Ridge reaches into his jacket and retrieves two ear headphones. He places them, drowning out Winston’s voice the very faint MUSIC of Grand Funk Railroad.  38.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude, not only is that rude, but you got shitty taste in tunes. INT. SCOTT’S BASEMENT - NIGHT Scott and Eric pause the game to refresh themselves with Gatorade and beef jerky. They’re laughing, having a ball. They remove their headsets and wipe their sweaty palms.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: You totally wailed on that last tactical assault.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Yeah... (beat) Dude, are we losers? scott (shocked, the craziest thing he’s ever heard) What?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: It’s prom night and we’re playing xX Box online with 12 year olds. scott (thinks) I’m sure the party is hella lame.

dialogues.speaker: BRIC
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just a bunch of drunk assholes staring at one another. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT The kids are in the living room - indeed, a bunch of drun assholes staring at one another. Some are slumped on couches. The girls have their purses, itching to leave... but waiting to see how things play ou Wendy is in the kitchen, naked beneath several towels, MUMBLING to herself. No one is going anywhere near her. Chris is frantically hiding all evidence of underage drin and drug use. Sasha talks on her cell.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (to everyone and no one) Feel free to help out you shits. “Don’t mind me and the five hundred bottles of hootch, Officer.”  39.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (into phone) No, I’m not dis-inviting you... Yes you’re cool enough for me. The party is really cancelled. She flips her phone closed. Brooke stands to the side. sh dials her own cell, listens. BROOKE’S DAD [VOICE] Hi, you’ve reached the Brannigans. Please leave us a message. Thanks. Brooke doesn’t know what to say, and hangs up the phone. Zach soothingly rubs her back. A GROUP approach the front door. Chris INTERCEPTS, locks

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you guys going?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Um... is there a reason to stay?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yes! ME. This isn’t MY problem. This is OUR problem. (noticing with SHOCK that Sasha is among them) Sash? What the FUCK?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: c’mon, Chris. If I miss prom I’m gonna kill myself. I can meet you there--

dialogues.speaker: ZACH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. We‘ll stick around. It’s the right thing to do. Zach is flanked supportively by Shams and Brooke. All around, people nod grimly - reluctantly agreeing with the sentiment. Nearby, ASHLEY confers with Jimmy and Moose.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna tell Katie’s parents?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: The cops take care of that. They’11 take care of everything.

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: I thought you hated cops.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...  40. Over to Chris and Weber, still standing near the front do They look out at the swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: My dad’s gonna freak. Weber feels the door RATTLE against his back.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It’s Doug. Open up!

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: Dude, you don’t want any part of Bese

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Let me in, or I'll break your toes. Weber shrugs and unhooks the deadbolt. Doug and Tyler cru in. Despite their tuxes, they still look like gorillas. Tyler, as usual, doesn’t say a word.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (seeing Chris) Bad news, Captain. No Nitrous... (re: the melancholy) Damn. Who fucking died? He bursts out laughing. He’s the only one.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: They’re here! Two police cruisers quietly roll in. The kids all get up. Some fix their clothes, still plotting their escape. The COPS exit their cars. One is OFFICER PAUL [in charge, earnest.] Val leans out the front door and calls to them.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: She’s around back! Officer Paul and another OFFICER move around to the back. The other two stay in front.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Please stay inside. Val moves inside and closes the door, All the kids move t the patio door - still covered in blood. Doug PUNCHES Weber, distraught.

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: What the hell?  41.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s for letting me in! They watch the cops cross the patio. Bob slides open the door and walks out. Zach, Brooke and Ashley follow him.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: She fell in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: It wasn’t our fault.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER 2
dialogues.text: Just step back and close the door. Officer Paul inserts his radio earpiece as he looks at th bloody pavement and the body in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: (into his walkie) Looks like-- what happened to the other kid. Yes, we’ do that.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER 1
dialogues.text: Get back.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: We didn’t do anything!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Did anybody leave the premises?

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: Please tell us what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah! It‘s my house!

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Son, stay back. I need to know--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (cause he’s a macho dick) This is bullshit. I’m taking off. officer Paul draws his gun. The other officers follow sui STARTLED the kids back up.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (trembling) No. No one’s left.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Good. Get in the house Now.  42.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I knew I hated cops, man. The kids look at the guns, freaked. They shut themselves The front is being watched by the two other officers. The sound of multiple ENGINES. A white van pulls up, followed by several black sUVs. The calvary has arrived! INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Panic is rampant. MURMURS percolate - the kids collective kick themselves for not bailing when they had a chance.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (losing his cool) What the hell’s going on, man? They can’t fucking do this!

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: (to Weber) I’m scared, will you hold me?

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: I’m so high right now. Is this serious, or am I just freaking out? Brooke looks to Zach. He puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: God I wish I was at Prom. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Agent Ridge exits his SUV, Winston is about to follow. Ri points as one might to a pet: “STAY.”

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: No way! I ain’t no dog! Ridge shrugs, then SLAMS the door on Winston and turns to address his MEN.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Dick! (trying the door) Let me out! AGENT RIDGE (CONT’D) Full perimeter. Phone and cellular service jammed. Now.  43. His men SCURRY. In the BG, others are barricading the driveway, searching the yard, and ERECTING LIGHT TOWERS AROUND THE PROPERTY. Officer Paul approaches, and extends hia hand. Ridge shak it... after a moments hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: They’re inside. I got men, front and back. Real mess by the pool, (looking, confused) Isn’t there a Medical team?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: The EMT that treated the kid across town is already showing symptoms.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: We wait for the CDC to arrive.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: I gotta tell you, it was hard pulling my weapon. These kids; it’s still a small town -- Officer Paul‘’s eyes shift as several AGENTS carrying hig powered RIFLES walk past.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: Perhaps its best if you leave. officer Paul smirks. These men are not likely to get alon INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BATHROOM - NIGHT Zach is on his cellphone, talking with his parents.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Hey Mom... actually things aren’t go great... I know you’re surprised to hear from me... Zach pauses. He really can’t think of anything to be gain by getting his poor parents all worked up just yet. ZACH (CONT’D) You know what, everything is fine. My nerves just got the better of me. You know how shy I am. A series of loud KNOCKS on the bathroom door.  a4.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY, (OFF)
dialogues.text: I need in! Seriously!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (into phone) I will, I promise... (attempting cheer) Don’t wait up. Hello? Hello? The cell has no service. Zach looks at himself in the mirror, starting to cry.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY, (OFF)
dialogues.text: (pounding) I’ll pee in the hall, swear to God!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (weakly) We’1l get through this. (beat, more confident) We’1l get through this. He chokes back the tears, wipes all expression from his f INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS Zach emerges from the bathroom, looking surprisingly collected. At the end of the hall, Doug has cornered Broo and is practically salivating over her.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: How come we don’t know each other?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Different schedules, different friends... (beat) Different species.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s not very nice. Zach approaches, steel in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (to Brooke) Cc’mon.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to Brooke, pushing Zach) You take orders from this midget?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Sure, This fans Doug’s flames. He pushes Zach again, harder. Za simmers with RAGE.  45.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: This isn’t the lunchroom, Doug. Don’t waste precious time--

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What’re you gonna do...? POP! Zach’s fist collides with Doug’s skull with surprisi ferocity. Doug’s head whips around, and he SLAMS into the wall. He stares at Zach; stunned, immobile.

dialogues.speaker: VAL, (OFF)
dialogues.text: Everybody! COME QUICK! zach and Brooke link arms and head towards Val’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I think they cut our phone service.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. (whispering, re: Doug) What’s his problem?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He’s pathologically averse to smart people. He’s hated me since kindergarten.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: I see, (beat) I’m sure hitting him helped.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I know. But it felt great. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Everyone is gathered around the television, staring wide- at a SPECIAL REPORT.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: It’s on TV! Quiet everybody! More kids ease in, take seats or lean against the walls. Wendy, lost in dementia, is on the far side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (TV)
dialogues.text: We interrupt previously scheduled programming with this bulletin...

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I don’t want to watch this! Heads turn to SSSSSHHHH her.  46.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (TV)
dialogues.text: News of a potential biological outbreak began here, at Last Stop Diner, after a delivery driver died from reported massive blood hemorrhaging. ON TELEVISION: SHOTS of the Diner. POLICE CARS WITH FLASH LIGHTS surround it. Cops exit their cars with guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYBODY IN
dialogues.text: Patrons and employees are bullied into the diner. Police keep their distance... just point their guns.

dialogues.speaker: DINER COP 2, (TV)
dialogues.text: (to Camera) Turn the Camera off! Now!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: My God.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (TV)
dialogues.text: Though they confirm the quarantine of the diner, authorities have still declined official statement. The faces of the kids watching are dark, twitchy.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (TV)
dialogues.text: We’ve also received word of a separate incident. As of yet, it’s relationship is unconfirmed. However, exclusive testimony indicates that this victim has also been quarantined. ON TELEVISION: SHOTS of Natasha’s house. NATASHA’S DAD (TV) Jack - I mean, he was a strong kid. I’d never seen anything like it. (choking up) The fact that my daughter had to see it-- Jesus. (listens to reporter) I just dropped her at the school dance. She couldn’t be dissuaded. (breaking down) She’s such a trooper...

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Ohmygod.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (overcome) Jack? Jack! No, no, no...!  47.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: That bitch went to prom!? ON TELEVISION: Baxter the hyper-aggressive terrier ATTACK the CAMERAMAN. As the camera TILTS down we SEF that the mongrel HAS OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INFECTION. NATASHA’S DAD (TV) No, Baxter! Bad dog!

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (TV)
dialogues.text: Residents are advised to stay in their homes--

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: (SCREAMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I DON’T WANT TO WATCH THIS!!! From seemingly nowhere, a VASE flies into the television screen. The screen SHATTERS in a explosion of SPARKS. Everyone stares at the gaping whole in the TV. Wendy just stands there, chillingly serene.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Please change the channel?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: You crazy bitch! Chris drops to the floor. He starts sweeping up the debri lost in OCD. TENSION in the room is electric.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: (standing) That’s it. I’m outta here.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: You heard the cops - you saw the TV - we’re supposed to stay put!

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY
dialogues.text: Until what?! When?! We all come down with this thing? No fucking thanks. I’m take my chances. He approaches the sliding glass doors, hesitates, then op them and steps outside. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, PATIO - CONTINUOUS Jimmy walks several feet. Nothing. No cops. No problems. He picks up the pace... The CRACKLE of a surge of electricity. The entire house i SUDDENLY bathed in BRIGHT WHITE LIGHT.  48. Jimmy shields his eyes, but SEES that enormous industrial work-lamps completely encircle the property. He FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through megaphone) Return to the house. The cdc should be here within hours. Until then, you all need to stay inside. Jimmy eyes the tree line on the far side of the pool. It’ only ten yards away... EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, HILLSIDE - CONTINUOUS Ridge stands beside Officer Paul. From their vantage poin they can see the entire property, lit like a baseball diamond. No one could come or go without their knowledge.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 2 VOICE, (WALKIE)
dialogues.text: I have him sir.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Ridge, he’s likely perfectly healthy...! Agent Ridge shrugs, unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: (to himself) Go back inside, kid. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, PATIO - CONTINUOUS Jimmy looks around. EVERYONE has gathered at the sliding glass doors to stare. He takes another few steps.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT 1, (0,8.)
dialogues.text: (through megaphone) Return to the house. You will be gate there. Everything will be ine. Jimmy pauses. He drops his head and turns towards the hou humiliated, defeated. THEN, HE UNEXPECTEDLY TURNS BACK, SPRINTING like the wind towards the tree line... CRACK! A RIFLE SHOT slices through the air. JIMMY’S HEAD SNAPS backward. He twists and falls into the hot tub, floating face down. The GROUP gathered at the sliding doors SCREAM en masse.  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston has removed part of the interior door panel in an ongoing attempt to escape. (The SUV, like most police vehicles, unlocks only from the outside.) We see he’s als removed the upholstery surrounding the sunroof. Frustrated, Winston grabs his radio and scans the frequen until he hears:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 1, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: The kid at the hospital just died.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE 2, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Have the toxicology reports brought here, and another sent to the cDC.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (into Radio) And bring back a pizza. And some beer. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, LIBRARY - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: A QUICK SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Lights illuminate an impressive home LIBRARY. Zach’s fingers SCROLL the bindings of an ENCYCLOPEDIA set Medical books are pulled from shelves. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, DINING ROOM - LATER This is the “War Room,” somber faces all around. Chris is utterly losing his cool; becoming less and less coherent. zach has taken charge, the “research” spread out before h

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: We’re in a stalemate until the cpc arrives.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (babbling) e..a total mess. Zoyla will never be able to clean this on her own...

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: We’re relying on info from the folks that just blew Jimmy’s head off?  50.

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: No, on common sense. It’s all over the news. They have to do something.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (re: Zach) I’m not listening to a single thing that shit-fuck says.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: (to Zach) Could anybody have it?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Potentially.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: What it is?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Not sure, but there’s disease called Necrotizing Fascitis. It’s an infection of muscle tissue and the skin. I think it’s something like that. Only worse. Brooke leans close to Zach. He puts his arm around her. Doug ROLLS HIS EYES.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a bacteria. The progression can happen in just hours. You get it like a cold, like mono.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: This blows. Shams grabs one of the books. Scans the page.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: The latest strain kills seven out of ten. The people who do live are left with huge scars- lost limbs... Shams passes one of the books around. SHAMS (CONT’D) There are some pictures. The kids pass around and react to the horrible images of mutilated bodies both pre and post-op. Lots of AMPUTEES.

dialogues.speaker: VAL
dialogues.text: Gross.  Sl.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: If I had those huge scars and stuff, I don’t know if I’d want to live. Is that shallow?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes it is.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Shut up. God, I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: The first sign is skin discoloration. As it spreads, it starts to blister. I guess we kind of know what can happen from there. Morose silence.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We need to figure out if anybody else has got it.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What we need to do is be extremely careful--

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (ignoring Zach) Yeah! I don’t want sick people hanging out in here!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (taking charge) Everybody, take off your clothes! We’ll do a... nude test. (to Brooke, grabbing his crotch) Wanna peek?

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: Zach? Doug’‘s gaze bores a hole into Zach. A competition for “leadership” has arisen...

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (sighing) I guess it’s an okay idea.

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: I‘m not taking my clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: (to no one in particular) Just so you know, I’m not bald down there. I shave.  52. Sasha looks at her “boyfriend,” completely repulsed. Sham nods his own, private approval. Cindy touches Moose’s arm

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Let’s just get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: Why not? For safety.

dialogues.speaker: MOOSE
dialogues.text: No fuckin’ way.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (menacingly) Do it. We all agree? Everyone nods.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Moose, let’s see some fatboy titty. Moose starts to take off his clothes: Jacket, Shirt, Sock Shoes, everything. Cindy picks up a long silver ladle and uses it to check under his arms and between his legs. Nearby, Bob is starting to SWEAT.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: He looks good.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Okay. Weber, you’re next. Cindy checks everybody around the table. While we DISSOLV through Cindy checking Weber, Kirstin, Doug... Shams READ

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: The pain is so unbearable that the body creates it’s own anaesthesia. It DESTROYS IT’S OWN NERVE CELLS.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: God! Please stop reading that shit, freakt

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to Cindy) Be thorough. We don’t want any fucking mistakes. We continue to watch Cindy check the kids. Now Zach, Broo and Tyler are looked at. Time is compressed with dissolve

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: What?!  53.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: A sore. People LEAP out of nearby chairs...they back away from BO Cindy moves back as well,

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: What? What?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: A black splotch. on his leg.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (jittery) Maybe it’s a zit!

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (calmly) Bob, just turn around and show us your leg. Bob shows the group the back of his thigh. There is a ver strange black splotch. Ashley GAGS.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my God...!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Hey everybody! Calm down!

dialogues.speaker: STAY RIGHT THERE, BOB
dialogues.text: Shams looks around. Everybody else has been checked.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: I think that’s everyone. (to offscreen) Sorry guys... REVEAL THAT Bob is not alone. He’s joined the ranks of ot random “Infected”: Kirsten, LARRY, and STEVE. Bob is scared, and a bit cold.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (pointing) What about HER? They follow his finger to... WENDY, still silently wrappe in a towel, listless and forgotten. She suddenly realizes that all eyes are upon her.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: What? What’s going on?  54. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT The house is QUIET. Kids slip shame-faced back into their clothes. Shams and Zach confer privately in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: How are things going with Brooke?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Best first date ever.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: This is pretty fucked up. We’re banishing people.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We’re isolating them to protect the healthy. (beat) I guess. Shams, I need to ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Have you done anything to place yourself at risk? Share a glass, a joint, anything - with someone we know is infected?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: (concentrates) No. No, I really don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (slowly) Did you kiss Katie? Shams BLANCHES. He hadn‘t even thought of that. He keeps his cool... Barely.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: No. No way, man! Lucky break too, cause man, you saw me trying... Zach sizes him up, concerned and unconvinced. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BASEMENT STAIRWAY - NIGHT Bob walks down a flight of stairs carrying his clothes in pile. He looks over his shoulder. Wendy and the OTHERS ar right behind.  55. Doug and Chris are their escorts. Both are wearing elbow- length yellow cleaning gloves and have white kitchen tras bags pulled over their torsos.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Don’t come so close to me, okay? Wendy just glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep going!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You guys can’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: I don’t have any sores! I’m okay! I’m clean!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Sorry sweetheart, but you fell in the soup, 80... you’re fucked. (grins cruelly) We all voted.
