dialogues.text: (re: screen) Move! Move, move move! (beat) Me? I don’t know. Beat the shit out of guys like you less often? Tyler and Shams characters are getting DESTROYED.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dude, these guys are good.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: NO FUCKIN’ WAY. Shams gets into it. His fingers hit the pads like crazy. squeezes as hard as he can. He watches his player onscree fight back. Then... We hear CRACK! CRACK! The sound is coming from Shams’s fingere as he wails away at the game.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Do it! Shams MASHES HIS PAD WITH ALL HIS MIGHT!

dialogues.speaker: A DOUBLE-CRACK
dialogues.text: Tyler looks over and discovers that SHAMS THUMBS ARE MISS Actually, they’re on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: THE FUCKI
dialogues.text: Tyler BELLOWS. Shams however, is remarkably calm. No screaming. Just devastating disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Can’t I catch a break? Shams tries to pick up his thumbs - an ironically difficu task without them attached to his hand. KIDS fill the doorway - Val, Zach, Brooke and the others behind them. Zach takes in the sight, heart-~broken. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, CELLAR - NIGHT Zach and shams confer on opposite sides of the thick door Guilt and sadness wrestle across Zach’s face.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Please. Please, Zach - I’m begging you. Don’t leave me in here.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: There‘’s got to be something you can do. You’re a bright guy.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Just hang in there. Help is on the way. You’ve just got to hang on.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Fuck you! They’re gonna let us rot and you KNOW IT! Think! There’s a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I don’t know what to do, Shams. He stands. Wipes tears from his eyes and starts down the long, narrow hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t leave me Zach! Zach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT Zach, Brooke, Sasha, and Doug are flipping channels in th guest bedroom. FLICK. An informercial for "Salad Shooter. FLICK. An old episode of “Facts of Life.” FLICK-—- They all stare listlessly. Zach strokes Brooke’s hair.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: I wonder what my sister’s gonna be like when she grows up.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You’ll get to see. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You can’t promise. You don’t know. CLOSE ON: Doug, sweating profusely. His eyes are red, his breath a bit labored. He scoots closer to Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (sudden outburst) Fuck! I need to FUCKING GET THE

dialogues.speaker: FUCK OUT OF THIS FUCKING PLACE
dialogues.text: They all STARE at him, stunned despite themselves.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What? Fuck you guys. He stumbles towards the bathroom. Zach is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He’s... off. (beat) More so than usual. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS CLOSE ON: Doug, who does indeed Look pretty damn crazy. Doug DISCOVERS that the walls, toilet and floor are plast with puke.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Pigs. He struggles with his zipper and PEES into the shower. He runs a free hand through his hair... then looks at his fingers. He sees blood.  76. He ZIPS up, then looks in the mirror. He SPREADS HIS HAIR apart - sees a BLOODY SORE that extends behind his ear. H tugs the top of his ear for closer inspection... and it c CLEAN OFF HIS HEAD. DOUG (CONT’D) No FUCKING way. He carefully tries to STICK the ear back on. It stays - secured by gooey layer of puss. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BEDROOM ~ NIGHT Doug reappears in the doorway looking worse and frighteni vacant. He’s completely snapped... or is about to. No one on the bed notices. Their eyes are glued to the NE

dialogues.speaker: JUDITH MARTIN, (TV)
dialogues.text: ++-Jill Valenzuela spoke with some of the students. Here’s the tape. The news CUTS TO footage of JILL VALENZUELA, a peppy reporter, interviewing kids AT THE PROM. She passes two k SLOW DANCING.

dialogues.speaker: JILL VALENZUELA
dialogues.text: What do you two think of the tragedy?

dialogues.speaker: DANCING GIRL, (TV)
dialogues.text: It’s a shame.

dialogues.speaker: JILL VALENZUELA, (TV)
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: DANCING GUY, (TV)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Total bummer. They two kids go back to slow dancing. We SEE that Natash ig miraculously recovered from her trauma. she’s in the a of a new BEAU. Jill walks over to three girls, MARYANN MCDONOUGH, a girl with way too much attitude, JANINE, and TRACI, a petite g who speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (to Doug) Hey ~ weren’t you going to Prom with MaryAnn?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (stonefaced) I blew her off. Came her instead.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Lucky break for both of you. JILL VALENZUELA (Tv) Did you guys know the kids at Chris Welch’s house? Janine leans into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: JANINE, (TV)
dialogues.text: I did. It’s so tragic you know. They were so young. Sasha starts to CRY. Zach and Brooke turn to one another.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Were?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (sobbing, gasping) Oh my God. Prom! Look... How... Beautiful... Jill Valenzuela turns to MARYANN MCDONOUGH. Doug’s jaw CLENCHES,.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Look Doug. Your sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: JILL VALENZUELA, (TV)
dialogues.text: I understand this evening is particularly hard for you. Your date is trapped in that house--

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANN, (TV)
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m MaryAnn. Let me first just say that I feel really bad for all of them. And I did feel really bad about Doug, too - I mean, I still do but-- sometimes he was such a jerk. If he’d just come directly to Prom like I asked...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Fuck you, MaryAnn. Traci pushes past MaryAnn and looks in the camera.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY, (TV)
dialogues.text: Yeah. I want to send all my wishes and prayers. But it’s true... Doug wasn’t very nice.

dialogues.speaker: JANINE, (TV)
dialogues.text: Yeah. He was so conceited. DOUG.

dialogues.speaker: JILL VALENZUELA, (TV)
dialogues.text: Our hearts are with these kids - struggling to enjoy their Bpecial night under these awful circumstances. Doug THROWS A GLASS at the screen, and the 2nd TV of the evening is OBLITERATED.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Dammit! That’s the last TV! Doug is SHAKING with rage. He looks like a volcano.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Wish those fucking bitches were heret

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Dude, settle.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Fucking all you fuckers are fucked! SUDDENLY: Doug’s EAR FALLS OFF. No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Fuck. Doug RUSHES for the window, throws it open. The RED LASER DOT from a rifle sight traces it’s way up his torso. Douc

dialogues.speaker: FUCKII
dialogues.text: He takes off down the hall. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, DINING ROOM - LATER Zach addresses the gathered troops. They hang on his ever word ~ he’s emerged as the clear leader.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Alright everybody. We looked, but there’s no sign of him. Alarmed WHISPERS spread through the group.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: He’s in here somewhere. (beat) I could take him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: He’s... a little nuts and hasn’t got anything to lose. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZACH (cont'd) That makes him much more dangerous. We need to watch each other’s backs. Weber raises his hand. Zach POINTS.

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: Watch our backs? We’re SCREWED. I mean, if the CDC doesn’t arrive goon, and now with a psycho running around--~

dialogues.speaker: ZACH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’1l come. This has become far too big. (darkly) But yes, for some of us the clock is ticking. We can’t stand by and do nothing while our friends die. Everyone looks down ~ towards the BASEMENT. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, CELLAR - CONTINUOUS BAM! The cellar door flies open. It’s Zach and Brook, wit a small set of curious bystanders. Moose Bob, and several others are in pretty bad shape. Wendy is STILL blemish fr Zach looks ready for war. Shams eyes him gratefully, optimistically.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Zach?

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: Hey there, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: I’m not sick! I swear, I’m not!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: There’s a chance you’re immune. I’m sorry that this happened to you, but you might be valuable to the CDC. Thank you for being so brave. Wendy calms immediately. Zach turns towards Chris:

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: Chris -

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (mangled jaw) Yeag - Warz sup?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I need power tools.  80. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BASEMENT HALLWAY - LATER We follow a long extension cord. It runs down the hallway past kids’ feet, and underneath the cellar door. Zach and Chris watch through the window. Cindy paces behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I can’t watch. She looks at Brooke expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: I’m staying. Sasha storms upstairs. Doug peek through the window.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Crazy mother-fuckers.... INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, CELLAR — NIGHT An impromptu MEDICAL STATION has been built. There are bo of bandages, scissors, twine, paper towels, a tube of antibacterial ointment, and TWO BOTTLES OF VODKA. Zach holds a CIRCULAR SAW. Sheets have been laid down on the floor. Shams is laid ou on top of them.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: (eying the circular saw) That’s a far cry from a scalpel. Zach waves Bob over. ZACH AND BOB throw SHEETS OVER THEIR HEADS. Eye holes have been cut out. THEY LOOK LIKE GHOSTS Bob puts his foot on Shams’ wrist. HE HOLDS IT DOWN. Zach puts Safety Goggles on. He lines up the blade on SHA FOREARM.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: You have to take off that much? Zach indicates where the discolored veins in the hand end healthy flesh begins.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: There’ s no point if we don’t get it

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: (lightly) Yeah, what’s an extra inch or two--  81.

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: Shams - you sure you’re cool? Shams nods and Zach squeezes the trigger. RRRRRRRRRR! BLOOD FLIES EVERYWHERE! WINE RACKS GET SPLATTERED.

dialogues.speaker: AAAAAAAAHHHE I
dialogues.text: PIECES OF BONE chip away and sail in the air. ZACH GRIMAC WITH STEADFAST DETERMINATION. Then, it’s time for Shams other wrist - and the left hand severed as messily as the right. The sick kids are huddled in a corner, facing away, blood over their backs. The saw WHINES to a slow stop. Brooke administers rapid medical attention... bandages, vodka, the works,

dialogues.speaker: 2ACH
dialogues.text: (raising his goggles) Who’s next?

dialogues.speaker: TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The grinding WHIR OF THE POWER SAW OVER: EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, STREET - CONTINUOUS The scene outside has become more melee than managed poli scene. Parents are swarming. News crews have literally se up camp. Even a PROTEST GROUP has made an appearance... Agent Ridge has detained several parents; Sargeant Frank being led away in cuffs, YELLING at the top of his lungs. A REPORTER and CAMERAMAN corner Agent Ridge.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: We understand that an entire small town in Bunyon County has undergone similar containment. The reporter thrusts the microphone in Ridge’s face and l it hover there. He doesn’t say a word.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Any comment on the situation inside the house? Ridge reaches over and plucks a cable from the side of th camera. The small light glowing on top dims. The camerama CURSES and Ridge walks away, soon joined by a JUNIOR AGEN  82.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR AGENT
dialogues.text: No sign of him sir. The cruiser he stole is still MIA too... NEARBY: Officer Paul is conversing with Zach's parents an Doug’s dad Dr. Viola.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: This is total chaos. ZACH’S DAD Is there anything we can do?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston is driving, utterly preoccupied with the array of fancy doodads on the dash: GPS, call monitors, data computer... he punches buttons arbitrarily. The radio crackles:

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (RADIO)
dialogues.text: Deputy Winston. You’re ordered to respond. Return the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) ¥’all can clean your own mess. WHAM! The cruiser CRASHES into an electrical pole. Two hi tension power lines fall to the asphalt, writhing like li snakes. Winston hurries from the car to survey the damage

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Whoops. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, STREET - CONTINUOUS There’s a loud electrical SNAP, then a strange deep, dron noise - like the world’s largest television set being tur off ~ BEEEEEEEEQOOOOOOOOOOP. The entire BLOCK is plunged into darkness. Every streetla every home, every traffic light... INCLUDING THE SECURITY LIGHTS WHICH SURROUND CHRIS’ HOUSE. INT. SCOTT’S BASEMENT, DARK - CONTINUOUS A FLASHLIGHT winks on. Scott and Eric are in the middle o the basements black void.  83.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: Tell me you saved the game. scorT We should have gone to Prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is a black abyss. Emergency lighting sputters to life above green exits signs, casting the alarmed student below in eerie silhouette. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BASEMENT — CONTINUOUS A lighter FLICKS, and the lonely butane flame casts a fut bubble of illumination. Zach’s face glows.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Did they cut the power?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: That wouldn’t make sense. Running FOOTSTEPS on the floor above their heads. The CRE ef a door opening. More FOOTSTEPS, Then, glass SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Shams, everyone, stay put. (to Brooke) Stay close. Led by light of the tiny flame, they move as quickly as t can through the door and up the stairs. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - NIGHT Officers and Agents surround the house, clutching flashlights, guns drawn. Under the veil of blackness, the property seems much larger, harder to easily canvas. PERSONNEL on the street scramble to reposition the Police vehicles so that the headlights illuminate the house. Tho they move with efficiency, the multiple distractions allo them to miss... A FEW SHAPES ESCAPING FROM THE HOUSE! NEARBY: Officer Paul observes the siege in progress with concern. Another OFFICER approaches:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Where’s our power, Lopez?  84.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER LOPEZ
dialogues.text: There’s a line down on Oak. We’re talking at least another fifteen. Officer Paul watches as Agent Ridge silently, cautiously leads a TEAM towards the patio.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: (to his men) No one leaves this house. Understood? INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Zach and Brooke reach the living room, a half-dozen kide watching as Weber delicately shimmies through a hole smas in one of the windows. Almost everyone has left.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Stop that! Zach grabs Weber by the belt-loops and pulls him back ins

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: What the fuck, dude!

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: I’m not dying in here, man. Zach looks out the window. He can see several SHAPES flee towards the treeline surrounding the property. It’s a cle narrow path to freedom. He glimpses Val, the last to esca disappearing into the thatch of woods.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: (to Zach) We have to stop them.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: If they contact more people, Weber this thing will be impossible to stop. (beat) Where were they going?

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: (shrugs, half-joking) Knowing these assholes, they’d be tempted to go to Prom-- Brooke and Zach eye one another with alarm, then glance a towards the window...  85.

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: Let the Police handle it, hero.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: The Police will kill them.

dialogues.speaker: WEBER
dialogues.text: They’re already dead. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Agent Ridge and his men reach the patio. In the pool, Katie’s body has dissolved into a nearly unrecognizable b The sliding doors leading inside are locked. Agent Ridge gestures for his men to SMASH the glass. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS The AGENTS step slowly into the living room, washed in th Muted yellow light of the idling Police Cars outside. FLASHLIGHT BEAMS scan the darkness, find the destroyed TV the blood-spattered kitchen. Drinking glasses... no kids. ACROSS THE HOUSE, more agents BURST through the front doo They motion the “All Clear.” Ridge looks uncharacteristically worried.

dialogues.speaker: RIDGE
dialogues.text: I want air support. They can’t have gotten far-- An AGENT emphatically gestures for Ridges attention, poin towards an open door and a stairway leading down. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, STAIRS ~ CONTINUOUS Ridge and his men step slowly down the stairs towards the basement, guns still at the ready. Ridge notices the extension cord snaking its way towards heavy cellar door. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, CELLAR - NIGHT The door CREAKS open. The darkness here is impenetrable. There is faint SCUFFLING. The Agents are not alone.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: Don’t be afraid. You’re all going to be okay.  86. Circles of light from the flashlights glide across the bl soaked walls. FIND the circular saw still dripping with gore... Then SUDDENLY FINDS CHRIS, who has pressed himsel flush against the wine racks, trying to hide. Terrified, Chris RUSHES FORWARD, babbling through the cav that used to be his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: OyMahGewd - plez gelp ge! The closest AGENT GASPS in disgust and surprise. He impulsively squeezes his trigger - CRACK! - and what rema of Chris’s face EXPLODES in a geyser. His body wobbles, t collapses to the floor. Several STIFLED SCREAMS echo against the stone walls. The Agents swivel on their heels nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston has gotten the Cruiser moving, but it’s on it’s l legs - every foot it traverses accompanied by the SCREECH grinding metal. The front end is hopelessly mangled, smok billows from beneath the hood.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: c’mon. C’MON-- The car dies, clanging to a permanent halt.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Fuck! He looks out the window. Directly beside him, at the rear an immense, full parking lot, is Mt. Vernon High. Right on cue, the power returns. The overhead fluorescent in the parking lot illuminate. A dim but distinct CHEER rises from the school - hundreds of relieved revelers celebrating the resumption of prom.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Sweet! INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BASEMENT - NIGHT The stand-off continues.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT RIDGE
dialogues.text: All of you. Come out! Nothing. No response.  87. SUDDENLY: the lights blaze back to life, and SHAPES lurki in the shadows become clear. The agents are startled. THEN: the kids make a collective RUSH towards the door — Shams, Bob, Moose, Kirsten, Ashley - the Agents take AIM: Moose is SHOT in the chest and collapses on an Agent, bleeding all over while smothering him with his girth. Agent Ridge lines up Ashley in his sights... But Shams and Bob wrestle him to the ground. Agent Ridge lands on the CIRCULAR SAW which WHIRS to life beneath him His mouth opens in a silent SCREAM, a fountain of blood erupting over his lips. INT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS The KIDS reach the empty living room, only to find more AGENTS, ready to pick them off one by one. They FREEZE. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE ~ CONTINUOUS The entire property is once more blanketed by the powerfu glow of security lights. Officer Paul stares at the house expectantly. The sound of GUNSHOTS pierce the quiet... and Officer Pau walkie blazes to life with PANICKED CHATTER.

dialogues.speaker: WALKIE
dialogues.text: (different voices) Ridge is down ... we’ve got six kids ... wounded, most dead... it’s a bloodbath ... NEWS CREWS scurry to make sense of the unfolding drama. Groups of PARENTS press against the officers who restrain them, desperate for anawers. Overhead, a HELICOPTER flies past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ring of teens loiter near the gym, taking quick, furtiv sips from concealed brown-bagged beer.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON, (OFF)
dialogues.text: What you got there?  88. They turn in unison. Winston is swaggering towards them, hands on hips. PANIC lights in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 1
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 2
dialogues.text: Yeah, nothing Officer. Winston snatches the paper bag from the closest teen, and peers inside. It’s a Colt 40.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN 3
dialogues.text: Please, please, be cool. It’s PROM, man. Winston sizes them up, overflowing with pantomime deliberation. He quickly confiscates all of their contraband.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Goon. Get back inside, don’t let me catch you out here again. They disburse like lightning in a chorus of “Thank Yous.” Once they’re out of sight, Winston chugs one. He tosses t bottle into the bushes and carries the remaining inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke run through the moonlight. They bob and weave to avoid sharp branches. Brooke trips over a log. She falls HARD.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You need to stop?

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: No. Brooke gets up. They keep running, trying to find their w They hear the helicopter overhead. A SEARCHLIGHT traces t ground nearby. They duck behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNIPER in the Helicopter has Zach in his sights.  89.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER PILOT
dialogues.text: (into radio) We have two runaways. Clean shot. EXT. CHRIS’ HUGE PARTY HOUSE - CONTINUOUS officer Paul is currently in command. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Stand down. We’ll intercept on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER PILOT
dialogues.text: Who is this? Where’s Ridge? It just so happens, Agent Ridge is being carried out of t house in a plastic bag...

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER PAUL
dialogues.text: Ridge is indisposed. Stand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter moves in one direction. Zach and Brooke ru in the other.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Do you know the way?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I_thought so. I think we’re close... Feeling they’ve lost their pursuers, they pause to catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m a little turned around. You okay? Brooke nods. They hear RUSTLING! They look around - Bpot the BUSH where it’s coming from. Zach PICKS UP A BIG STICK and holds it over his head. Bro picks up a smaller one. The bush rustles again and Zach SWINGS. He hits... A BODY EDDIE, a party-guy in a tuxedo, rolls out.

dialogues.speaker: OWWWWWW
dialogues.text: Two more party-guys, LYLE and MITCH, emerge from the bush  90.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Fuck! We thought you were cops.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LYLE
dialogues.text: We came out here to drink.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Wait... Mitch looks at Zach and Brooke, still splattered with blo from their “surgical” endeavors. MITCH (CONT’D) Where did you guys come from?

dialogues.speaker: LYLE
dialogues.text: They got that... “thing!”

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: No. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE
dialogues.text: Look at them! They were at Chris’! Lyle and Mitch pick up sticks, take an offensive posture.

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Get away.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We'll go. Just, tell us which way the prom is.

dialogues.speaker: L
dialogues.text: Forget it! Lyle swings at Zach. He misses.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: I’m not sick! I’m trying to help! Doug is on his way to-- Mitch swings. He hits Zach in the leg.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Help us! Please! Mitch CLUBS Zach in the shoulder. Zach’s had enough. He lays a HUGE SWING into Mitch’s RIBS. BOOM! Mitch goes dow He chokes as he tries to get his breath. Zach looks to Ly ZACH (CONT’D) Which way?  91. Lyle points. 4%ach and Brocke run like hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead Zach and Brooke see the HIGH SCHOOL.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Over there! They run past a convenience store. Brooke does her best t keep up. Zach blazes into an intersection. He look behind him to check on Brooke. SCREEEEFECH - A CAR HITS Zach. Zach bounces off the windshield and somersaults onto the pavement. Brooke reaches him.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah. I think so. Zach is WooZY, his pants torn and the flesh beneath deepl gouged. The IRATE DRIVER gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: IRATE DRIVER
dialogues.text: What the fuck, kid! You ran into the middle of the road-- He takes long look at Zach, who’s struggles to his feet i the beam of the headlamps. He’s bloody, wild-eyed, and pissed. This is definitely NOT the same Zach we met yesterday... The Driver shuts up and closes his door. Brooke grabs him. Zach follows, now slowed by a LIMP.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Come onl cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK pulls up in front of the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha prepares to climb out of the cab. The TRUCK DRIVER leers at her hungrily. Sasha is... not all there. Sweat beads on her forehead.  92.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Thanks for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Glad I could help, darling. (beat) Quick kiss for luck?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: C’mon. Peck on the cheek. Don’t normally pick up hitchhikers... Sasha rolls her eyes. Whatever. As she leans in for the micro-smooch, the truck driver turns his head and kisses FULL ON THE MOUTH, pulling Sasha forward greedily.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: {tearing away) Fuck you, pig!

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: You have a nice night, Sweetheart. You go make some horny boys night. She flips him off. He GRUNTS like a pig as she scampers towards the Gym. His LAUGHTER tapers as she dovetails fro view, his expression shifting to dawning displeasure. He something in his mouth. He fishes inside with a finger an retrieves... A BLOODY TOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winded by her brief jog, Sasha stops at a parked car to inspect her reflection. She adjusts her hair. Puckers her lips, then is seized by a COUGH... which expels a blob of dark blood onto the car window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BAND takes a break and a DJ [50s, hopelessly out of touch] takes over a turntable. He unsleeves an album and places it on the spindle. The g floods with Air Supply’s “Two Less Lonely People.” Kids MOAN, but don’t stop dancing. CLOSE ON: The DJ, oblivious, nodding his head to the smooooocoth rhythm. SUDDENLY an unseen hand SHOVES him. WINSTON takes his place, record in hand.  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids shake their heads and hair to “Pour Some Sugar on Me Winston makes the rounds, nods and points double-barrel fingers at clusters of teens who smile back, confused. He FINDS two HUSKY GIRLS and saunters over.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: How’re you ladies tonight?

dialogues.speaker: HUSKY GIRL 1
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: All alone?

dialogues.speaker: HUSKY GIRL 2
dialogues.text: Our dates took off. Evidently drinking in the fields is more fun-- The first girl ELBOWS her.

dialogues.speaker: HUSKY GIRL 1
dialogues.text: You don’t have to tell everybody. Winston discretely removes his HIP FLASK... Then notices NEWS CREW on the far side of the gym. Local reporter JILL VALENZUELA is still pestering Prom-goers.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: We should find a place to party.

dialogues.speaker: HUSKY GIRL 1
dialogues.text: Aren’t you a cop?

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: off duty. They glance at one another, uncertain. WINSTON (CONT’D) This is Prom Night, ladies. Love is in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston and the two girls hang out on the floor, drinking recently liberated beer. At the far end of the hall, a FIGURE bangs on the doors. Winston excuses himself and cruises down the hali.  94. He opens the door a crack. Standing outside, grinning calmly, is Doug.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: What up, dude?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey-- (taking in Winston’s uniform) Officer. Will you let me in?

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: What's wrong with the front door?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It’s just, look, I forgot my asthma inhaler, and all this dancing... I got an extra one in my locker--

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Whatever. He lets Doug pass, not noticing the BLOOD which coats the side of the young man’s face. Instead, Winston trots excitedly back to his “dates” and Doug disappears down another corridor. INT. MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL, GYMNASIUM — NIGHT SLOW MOTION Pov: Moving through throngs of dancing studen who shake and shimmy, pausing with momentary curiosity as they’re passed. REVEAL: Sasha carving her way across the dance-floor towa the stage. Her eyes are fixed on something there: CLOSE ON: the focus of her fascination. Resting on a faux marble pedestal wait the CROWNS for Prom King and Prom Qu She grins - missing a front tooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE: Doug travels from door to deor, sealing each one closed via an assortment of different means: bike chains, rope, blocking them with chairs... CLOSE ON: Doug removing the FIRE AXE from its wall-mounte tomb in breakaway glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL — NIGHT, CONTINUOUS zach and Brooke reach the Gym. They eye the front entranc

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Let’s do this--

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: We can’t risk getting caught. (beat) I mean, look at us. We have to find a back entrance. INTERCUT: Each door they try has already been secured. Do is perpetually one step ahead. They reach the last door. It too is locked, and the frustration in Zach’s face is plain.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: We're wasting too much time.

dialogues.speaker: ZACE
dialogues.text: (beat) I’ve got an idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach breaks down the door to the 4-H gardening shed. He grabs a rake and a hoe. Zach SMASHES the window leading into the locker room. Zach and Brooke cut through the locker room to... CUT TOs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: Zach and Brooke, gardening tools in hand. PULL BACK: They’re at the rear of the Gym, bloody, pale-f Grim Reapers bathed in pink and green light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke dash from couple to couple, from group to group, from Hor’dourve table to punchbowl - Spreading the word... messengers of the Apocalypse.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You need to get out of here!  96.

dialogues.speaker: CHEERLEADER
dialogues.text: The pretty girls are at Chris’! I actually have a shot at Prom Queen! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: At least go outside?

dialogues.speaker: JOCK
dialogues.text: I step out, I break hearts. can’t let that happen... CUT TOs

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: You don’t understand! Infected kids might BE here!

dialogues.speaker: BAND GEEK
dialogues.text: But we go back on in fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: A SUDDEN HUSH descends over the gymnasium. All heads TURN the stage. The DJ removes the needle from the record. Sasha stands alone, the Prom Queen Tiara in her hand, blo dribbling from the corners of her mouth. She addresses th vast assembly of staring faces. This is her moment.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Thank you all sooo much. This is such an honor. A dream come true, really. She places the Tiara an her head.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Is it on right? It feels weird-- Sasha over-exerts her attempt to squeeze the metal orname over her hair -- and PEELS THE FLESH from her scalp! She smiles and waves benignly, blood pouring through down forehead and cheeks, pausing to COUGH several enormous GO which splash into the crowd. Kids SCREAM and SCATTER. Balloons POP. ONE END OF THE BANNER falls. Tables and chairs get toppled. They’re literally climbing and crawling over one another to reach doors first. JUST THEN: Winston and his two “dates” return from their sojourn in the hallway.  97. SWISH-PAN FROM WINSTON’S POV: Groups simultaneously disco that the doors are all jammed. A few find the open route leading back to the locker room, but most are trapped.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) God dammit. Winston turns on his heels and heads back into the school abandoning his heavy-set new friends. The THRONGS stream towards the main deors, but the path i blocked by DOUG, wielding his axe. bDoUG

dialogues.speaker: HI GUYS
dialogues.text: (grins) You know, I had no idea how unpopular I was. Guess I should have been nicer. Fact is, I hate all of you even more than you hate me. But even a bully needs love... The crowd slowly backpedals away from him. He spots Mary in their midst, trying desperately to avoid his eyes. DOUG (CONT’D) MARY ANN MCDONOUGH! Baby! The herd PUSHES her forward. The rest shy away from her. DOUG (CONT’D) Ahhh. Come here, pumpkin. Doug slowly pute his hands around her head. She cowers. DOUG (CONT’D) I was dying, and you said such awful things. She squirms. He holds her tight and kisses her hard on th mouth, like Michael Corleone kissed Fredo. DOUG (CONT’D) Love yal She rune away.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who else wants a warm fuzzy one? CLANG! Zach’s garden hoe connects squarely with the side Doug’s head. BLOOD SPRAYS into the crowd, hitting unprepa gawkers in the face.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: (to the crowd) Go on! Run!  98. Doug is already clamoring to his feet, reaching for the a EXT. MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL -— CONTINUOUS There is a MASS EXODUS from the Hall. Kids in formal wear run for their lives WAVING AND SCREAMING, just as: POLICE CARS, SIRENS walling, fly over the curb. The cops lean out of their windows, GUNS DRAWN.

dialogues.speaker: CURB COP
dialogues.text: Everyone! Back inside! The cops get out of their cars. They all hear a DISPATCHE across their radios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids, hands raised, back inside. THE COPS SHUT THE ENTRANCE DOOR. Two officers take huge CHAINS and look the door from the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three PREPPIE KIDS, poug’s blood on their formal wear, sc down the corridor - their backs hunched like soldiers crossing an open field.

dialogues.speaker: PREPPIE KID 1
dialogues.text: (whispering) Maybe we can get out through the library.

dialogues.speaker: PREPPIE KID 2
dialogues.text: I got that assholes blood all over us. FROM NOWHERE: The axe blade Splits the 2nd Preppie Kid’s skull in HALF! Blood and brains SPLATTER THE wall,

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: The other two SCREAM, but their distress is ended quickly Doug severs their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke lead a group towards the coach’s offices funnels them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ann comes running around the corner. She tries to ge into the room.

dialogues.speaker: DANCING GIRL
dialogues.text: NO! SHE CAN’T COME IN! DOUG

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANN
dialogues.text: (crying) Pleaset

dialogues.speaker: ZACE
dialogues.text: It’s okay!

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: (to Mary Ann) Just stay in the corner. Mary Ann sits on the floor. Everybody glowers at her. Then... SCREAMING along with Doug’ LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Stay here. Don’t open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winston wanders the halls, the carnage of Doug’s passage around him, bodies in the hall, smashed lockers, severed electrical wiring resulting in sputtering lights overhead He comes upon the three dead Preppie Kids. He considers t for a LONG BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (to himself) Best to handle this the Bunyon County way. QUICK SERIES OF CUTS: Winston emerges from the Chemistry Classroom wearing a thick rubber apron, long latex gloves and carrying bottles of Isopropyl Alcohol. He laboriously drags the bodies into a haphazard pile. He empties the Alcohol over the corpses. He retrieves a silver Zippo from a pocket and sets them o fire... Whistling, he walks away.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug twirls the axe absentmindedly like a lumberjack on a morning stroll. He rounds a corner, and finds himself face-to-face with t fleeing members of the STUDENT BAND. Each are lugging the beloved instruments and Look utterly terrified, It’s a “West Side Story” gangland stand-off; the axe-wiel Maniac vs. the DRUMMER, the SAXOPHONIST, and the VIOLINIS The Saxophonist cocks the heavy brass behind his body. As he’s about to attack... Doug swings the Axe- hitting him THE ANKLE. The Saxophonist goes down. Doug then turns on the other two, swinging wildly, narrow missing. The drummer assaults Doug with the Crash Cymbal. He pulls back again, carving a deep slice of arm before t disk CLATTERS to the floor, Doug awings the axe upwards. IT OBLITERATES the violin, t strikes the violinist on the inner thigh. SPLOTCH! Doug has trouble getting the axe back out of the deep wou The VIOLINIST HOWLS in pain. Using one cymbal as a shield, another as a weapon, the Drummer redoubles his assault. Doug abandons the axe, letting it dangle between the SCREAMING violinist’s legs. He picks the Cymbal from the floor... and throws it like a Frisbee. It slices through drummer’s neck, striking the WINDPIPE AND VIBRATES. GONG! His work done, Doug reclaims the axe with a sickening WET SQUELCH. He continues on his merry way, leaving the three bleeding, writhing victims in hia wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke tiptoe the hall, still brandishing rake a hoe respectively. In the Trophy Case up ahead, Zach spots DoUG’Ss REFLECTIO but a moment too late! Doug is upon them, swinging the axe. Brooke takes refuge a nearby classroom. Zach falls back, CRASHING through the trophy case, then i pummeled by the falling trophies.  lol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug walks in. He looks around, peeks under the desk... Brooke has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Lambchop? Then..... DING! Brooke comes out from behind the open doo and SLAMS Doug IN THE HEAD WITH AN ELECTRIC TYPEWRITER. D hits the floor. Doug puts his hands up as a futile shield; his head has t quite a beating, and the left side of his face has been turned to pulp. Blood spills over his fingers. Brooke picks up the typewriter again. She hurls it at his head repeatedly: DING! CLICK! CHING! Doug writhes in pain. DOUG (CONT’D) Fucking bitch! Brooke runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke pulls Zach from the Trophy Case and drags him off the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Zach! I can’t WAIT to kill you! Zach and Brooke run towards a corridor of classrooms... a smack into WINSTON.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Oh thank God, we need your help, Officer--

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Deputy.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Zach peers over Winston’s shoulder. Smoke is billowing ou of several classrooms. Winston is still FLICKING the silv lighter in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?  102. Winston follows his wide-eyed gaze, and notices that the flames from his funerary burn piles have spread to the wa and ceiling,

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Whoops. (Beat; as though the hallway behind him wasn’t on fire) Gotta take a leak.

dialogues.speaker: BROOKE
dialogues.text: What the hell smells so bad? (looking closer) Holy shit! INT. MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL, MEN’S ROOM — NIGHT Zach and Winston bravely open bathroom stalls. The last o is locked. Zach KICKS IT OPEN. Inside is... MR. SHEPPARD. Mr. Sheppard crouches atop the toilet, rubbing ROSARY BEA and WHISPERING A PRAYER.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Say something nice for me too. Winston and Zach step up to the urinals. Brooke takes a stall.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: So... You do realize there’s hundreds of Kids trapped in here.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Yeah. INT. MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL, GYMNASIUM — CONTINUOUS The gym is starting to fill with smoke and looks more lik third world refugee camp than a high school prom. Students cower in corners, assiduously avoid one another, peek gut back windows towards the gathering POLICE circus outside... Sasha’s corpse lies crumpled on stage. Natasha approaches the first signs of a SORE appearing around her mouth. She gingerly removes the Tiara from her friends exposed skull CLOSE ON: The broad, rigor-mortis smile on Sasha’s face.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke carefully peeks out of the bathroom; coast is clea Zach and Winston follow. As they do, the axe flies through the doorway! Winston pushes Zach out of the way and the blow catches Winston i the back of the thigh. His legs SPLITS. Brooke drops her rake and lunges for the axe head. She wrests it away from Doug, but trips over Winston and land the blade. A pool of biood slowly forms beneath her falle form. Doug snatches her rake, Zach and Doug face off. Its garden rake against garden ho

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Think you can take me, faggot? They fence, but Zach is a man possessed, He lands every blow, Doug stumbles backwards — surprised and winded, The two stare at one another. Zach stands his ground, ferocity gleaming in his eyes. Doug looks Like he’s about CHARGE... +++ but FLEES instead, racing back through the hallway towards the rear double doors. BXT, MT. VERNON HIGH SCHOOL -— CONTINUOUS Doug staggers outside. He’s exhausted, low on blood. A GUNSHOT rings. Doug looks down, where a bloody hole has opened in his chest. He looks up to finds: Officer Paul, standing with gun still raised - flanked by several other OFFICERS. In the BACKGROUND, white CDC vans stream into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teams of CDC AGENTS wearing biohazard suits efficiently evacuate the STUDENTS into waiting school buses. Familiar faces are herded past: Zach, Brooke, Natasha... Winston, A LIMPING Winston is staging a loud protest to n one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: I’m not getting on that bus. No way. Officer down. (pointing at his badge) See this word? DEPUTY? It means “NOT. GETTING. ON. BUS.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, FIREMEN extinguish the remaining flame licking at the school walls, just as: A 1986 Dodge Dart sputters into the parking lot, stopping appreciable distance away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Eric, dressed in tuxedos replete with matching boutonnieres, have finally made it - and missed everythin scotT What the fuck...?

dialogues.speaker: ERIC
dialogues.text: See? Told you Prom would suck. INT. CHRIS’S HUGE PARTY HOUSE, BASEMENT ~ NIGHT CDC AGENTS escort Shams and Wendy - the only two survivor away from the house. The two seem to have made... a connection. Shams is carrying his amputated hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMS
dialogues.text: Anybody got a cooler and some ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach and Brooke cradle one another. The wound on her ches hae been bandaged with an enormous swatch of gauze. Winst is seated behind, his stream of belly-aching still unbrok

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: I shouldn’t be here! Zach turns to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: It’ll be okay, man.

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: It’s been a bad day.

dialogues.speaker: ZACH
dialogues.text: Yeah. But it’s over now. Winston nods, numbly.... +.ethen reaches absentmindedly to scratch a small red SOR behind his ear.

dialogues.speaker: TAG ENDING
dialogues.text: The Truck Driver - the one who stole the kiss from Sasha unwinding at a local STRIP CLUB. A young BIKINI BRUNETTE giving him a lap dance runs her fingers through his hair, then pulls away, alarmed,

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPER
dialogues.text: What the fuck?!

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Song’s not done.

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPER
dialogues.text: No. But I am! Gross! She looks at her hand. It’s streaked with blood.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: I got lots of dances tonight. Yours sucked. He gets up and leaves the booth. We FOLLOW him through th club, PULLING BACK to reveal the crowded space. GIRLS lea customers back and forth from the back room... ees all of them now potentially infected.
